author: Meduza
title: Putin meets with Russians freed by Hamas, expresses gratitude for 'humanitarian act'
text:
On Wednesday, Vladimir Putin met with several Russian citizens who had been freed from captivity by Hamas. The president welcomed to the Kremlin Alexander Trufanov — released by Hamas on February 15, 2025 — along with his mother Elena Trufanova and fiancée Sapir Cohen, who were freed in late 2023. Also present at the meeting were Russia’s chief rabbi, Berel Lazar, and the president of the Federation of Jewish Communities of Russia, Alexander Boroda.
During the meeting, Putin thanked Hamas for releasing the hostages. “We must express our gratitude to the leadership and political wing of Hamas for cooperating with us and carrying out this humanitarian act,” he said, adding that Russia would “do everything possible to ensure such acts take place more often.”
Twenty-nine-year-old Alexander Trufanov, a dual citizen of Israel and Russia, was abducted from the Nir Oz kibbutz during Hamas’s attack on Israel on October 7, 2023. While being abducted, Trufanov was shot in both his legs. He and two other Israeli citizens were released on February 15 as part of a deal between Hamas and Israel.
In mid-January, Israel and Hamas reached an agreement on a temporary ceasefire and the release of 33 Israeli hostages in exchange for nearly 2,000 Palestinian prisoners. Attempts to extend the agreement failed, and Israel resumed military operations in the Gaza Strip on March 18. Hamas is still holding 59 Israeli hostages. According to the Israel Defense Forces, at least 35 of them are confirmed dead.
Hamas militants killed more than 1,200 people, mostly civilians, and took some 250 people into captivity in Gaza in October 2023. In March 2025, Palestinian health authorities said Israel’s ground and air campaign had killed more than 50,000 people, with nearly a third of the dead under the age of 18. Two months earlier, a peer-reviewed statistical analysis published in The Lancet journal concluded that the official Palestinian tally of direct deaths likely undercounted the number of casualties by around 40 percent in the first nine months of the war.

title: Brescia: Mostra "Photo Mail art"
text:
Brescia: Mostra "Photo Mail art"
Cosa si scambiano gli artisti?

author: Jeff Lehr | jlehr@joplinglobe.com
title: Rural Joplin man to stand trial on vehicular assault charges
text: A judge decided Thursday that there was probable cause for a 62-year-old rural Joplin man to stand trial on charges that he tried to run down a neighbor couple on a moped with his car. Judge Joseph Hensley indicated at the conclusion of a preliminary hearing in Jasper County Circuit Court that he would be binding Richard W. Dousa over for trial on two counts of first-degree assault pending a decision on his attorney’s request to lower his bond. Dousa has remained in custody since his arrest for allegedly chasing and trying to hit a moped that Jonathan Plummer and his girlfriend were riding June 14 on Missouri Highway 171. His cash-only bond was set initially at $500,000 and subsequently lowered to $50,000, an amount the defendant has not been able to put up. The Jasper County prosecutor’s office has filed for the court to treat the defendant as a prior and persistent offender and remains opposed to any further bond modification. His neighbor, Jonathan Plummer, testified Thursday that he could hear Dousa raging about something outside Plummer’s trailer home the day in question. As Plummer went to leave the trailer court with his girlfriend, Dousa kept yelling at him, and Plummer acknowledged that he called the defendant a derogatory term in response. Plummer said that moments later, the couple found the defendant chasing them down with his car. “It was clear to me he was trying to run us off the road,” Plummer said. Defense attorney Bob Briggs asked Plummer how close he believed Dousa’s car actually came to hitting them, and Plummer said he came within 4 to 5 feet. In an attempt to shake him, Plummer said, he pulled into the satellite office of the sheriff’s department at Airport Drive. But Dousa chased them through the yard of the office in his car. Jasper County Deputy Matthew Leek, who responded to a call reporting the matter and went to the defendant’s address to speak with him in the aftermath, said Dousa held out his hands as he approached him and said: “Take me to jail.” Leek said Dousa then proceeded to repeat several times that he would kill Plummer and that his neighbors were lucky Leek showed up because he would have shot them both. The prosecutor’s office cited in a court filing Dousa’s prior convictions for aggravated assault in Pennsylvania and assault with a dangerous weapon in Wyoming as its reasons for treating him as a prior and persistent offender.

author: ET Online
title: Delhi weather: Dense fog covers national capital as temperature remains low; Flight ops impacted - The Economic Times
text: The national capital saw dense fog on Friday morning, with the minimum temperature in the city recorded at 7 degrees Celsius, the weather department said. The IMD on Wednesday also forecast an active western disturbance starting today, which is expected to raise temperatures in eastern, central, and northern India over the next 3-5 days. However, the western Himalayan region is likely to experience heavy rain and snowfall due to the disturbance. We are forecasting a western disturbance that may become active from tomorrow. Along with this, there is a possibility of another western disturbance. Temperatures may rise in east, central, and north India in the next 3-5 days, IMD scientist Soma Sen Roy said.On Wednesday, the national capital experienced a significant dip in temperatures, as the mercury in many regions has plummeted significantly as the cold weather prevails at the start of the new year.According to the India Meteorological Department, the minimum temperature at Delhi's Palam has dipped further to 6.5 degrees Celsius on Thursday from 7 degrees Celsius on Wednesday.Flight operations impacted:Additionally, a thick layer of fog has enveloped the national capital as well as swept through several major cities across the nation.Airlines inlcuding IndiGo and Air India released advisories for the passengers in light of dense fog. Due to significantly low visibility in Srinagar and Chandigarh, there have been changes to flight schedules. We recommend customers to recheck their flight status before travelling to the airport http://bit.ly/3ZWAQXd. Wishing for clearer skies! said IndiGo in its advisory. Poor visibility in Delhi and parts of Northern India may affect some of our flights, said Air India.

author: malinga
title: Eight Sri Lankans rescued from trafficking scam in Myanmar arrive - DailyNews
text: The Foreign Affairs Ministry in coordination with Sri Lanka Missions in Myanmar and Thailand facilitated the repatriation of eight Sri Lankans who were trafficked for forced criminal activities in cyber scamming compounds in Myanmar. Myanmar law enforcement authorities rescued these Sri Lankans on April 4, following the request by the Government of Sri Lanka. The Sri Lanka Embassy officials in Bangkok received them on April 11 at the Mae Sot border gate in Thailand, and subsequently they were brought to Bangkok and provided accommodation until their repatriation was arranged with the assistance of the International Organization for Migration. The International Organization for Migration provided logistical assistance in repatriating the rescued Sri Lankans. The Sri Lankan Embassy in Myanmar, through the Eden Foundation, a charity organization based in Myanmar, provided them with food and other necessities during their temporary stay at the Myawaddy Police Station following the rescue from traffickers. The Consular Affairs Division of the Ministry coordinated the repatriation process in collaboration with relevant stakeholders and Consular Affairs Director General of the Foreign Ministry A.S.K Senavirthne received the eight Sri Lankans at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA). The eight Sri Lankans expressed their appreciation to the Foreign Affairs Ministry for its efforts in ensuring their safe return to Sri Lanka. The Foreign Affairs Ministry thanked the Governments of Myanmar and Thailand and other stakeholders, including IOM for their assistance.

author: Oliver Adey
title: Reassurance: the sector is recovering, Hurricane Milton less violent than feared
text:
(Boursier.com) — Phew of relief for the reinsurance sector. Large European groups such as Swiss Re and Munich Re are making progress on the stock market as Hurricane Milton moved away from the coast of eastern Florida after making landfall near Tampa. Experts estimate that the cost of the natural disaster could be lower than initially feared, as the strength of the hurricane had diminished before making landfall.
“Reinsurers’ fears that Hurricane Milton could result in losses of more than $100 billion could be allayed, with losses potentially lower than the $60 billion incurred during Hurricane Ian in 2022, which “Milton moved to Category 3 before landfall,” said Charles Graham, an analyst at Bloomberg Intelligence. Abid Hussain, an analyst at Panmure Liberum, says that although it is too early for loss estimates, it will probably be a loss of less than $50 billion for the insurance sector. “Milton could be one of the most destructive hurricanes ever recorded in west-central Florida,” warned the United States National Hurricane Center (NHC).
In Paris, the Score rises 2.4% to 20.5 euros.
©2024 Boursier.com

author: VNExplorer
title: AFL star Daniel Gorringe looks dapper as he marries girlfriend Ana Cannon in a stunning rural ceremony
text:
READ MORE: Daniel Gorringe set to come out of retirement for surprising gig
Daniel Gorringe has tied the knot with girlfriend Ana Cannon.
The former AFL player, 31, and Big Brother star shared the news to Instagram on Sunday, alongside two special images from the couple’s big day.
In the first picture, Daniel looks dashing in a sleek suit, white dress shirt and tie as he looks down at his ladylove, and wraps his arm around her waist.
Elsewhere, his blushing bride looks divine in an ethereal gown embellished with statement blooms.
Ana wore her brunette locks back on her special day and highlighted her delicate features with a subtle makeup palette.
Daniel Gorringe has tied the knot with girlfriend Ana Cannon. The former AFL player, 31, and Big Brother star shared the news to Instagram on Sunday, alongside two special images from the couple’s big day. Both pictured
In a second frame, the couple are seen with their backs to the camera in a rural setting, looking at a fireworks display
In a second frame, the couple are seen with their backs to the camera in a rural setting, looking at a fireworks display.
Ana captioned the memories simply.
‘It has always been you,’ she wrote alongside a love heart emoji.
The couple’s news was soon inundated with well wishes.
‘Sobbing,’ wrote Big Brother’s Sarah McDougal. ‘Stop it,’ added co-star Mat Garrick.
Another follower wrote: ‘This is the best wedding ever of the year.’
Gorringe proposed to Ana in November 2021.
Gorringe proposed to Ana in November 2021. Both pictured
‘On Friday I asked my best friend to marry me (for real this time). Here’s to forever loving you’, he wrote at the time.
Ana also shared a photo of the precious moment, in which she cuddles up to her man while holding a glass of Champagne and flaunting her ring.
She captioned it simply with a love heart and the date of the engagement, ‘19.02.21’.
He wrote: ‘On Friday I asked my best friend to marry me (for real this time). Here’s to forever loving you’. Ana also shared a photo of the precious moment, in which she cuddles up to her man while holding a glass of Champagne and flaunting her enormous diamond ring
So sweet! Ana clutched her face and cried out, ‘Oh my god!’ as she was presented with her ring

author: , Wicked Local
title: Robots with weapons? Bill would make that illegal in Massachusetts
text: BOSTON — It was a special "dog" that captured the attention of legislators, state workers and even tourists at the Massachusetts State House on Thursday. It responded to commands: Stay! Go! and even Down! But the commands were sent electronically through a joystick and the dog, dubbed Spot, was robotic. A flame-throwing robotic dog, like the Thermonator , for sale to the general public for $9,500, it is not. The robot dog, created by Boston Dynamics , was at the State House to encourage legislators to support a bill that would prohibit the weaponization of robots. Sponsored by Sen. Michael Moore, D-Millbury and Rep. Lindsay Sabadosa, D-Northampton, the bill advocates for the responsible, ethical and safe use of advanced robotic technology. Among other things, the bill would make it illegal for anyone, including a law enforcement agent, to manufacture, modify, sell, transfer or operate a robotic device or drone that is equipped with a weapon, or to use such a device to physically restrain a person. "We have an ethics policy," said David Robert, director of human/robot interaction for Boston Dynamics, the maker of Spot. "We are creating robots to be friendly and useful, not harm or hurt people or animals." The Boston Dynamics device has been sold in 40 different countries. Its primary use is to replace humans in tedious or dangerous tasks, such as disposing of explosive or suspected explosive devices. “We can send in the robot to places that are too dangerous for humans,” Robert said. A Canadian power plant purchased a Spot to throw a switch that would arc every time it was engaged. Workers were too uncomfortable to accomplish the task, so the company called in Spot. “Spot can help keep humans out of harm’s way.” The New York City Fire Department has one, dubbed Bergh, after the founder of the ASPCA, and it is painted to look like a Dalmatian. The device is teachable, Robert said, explaining that Spot can be taught, or programmed, to perform tasks without human supervision. It can record a route or a sequence of events and perform those without supervision as well. “The robot is doing the work automatically but with the ability to have a human override its program,” Robert said. Transparency is part of the company’s philosophy. The device is not encased in a furry substance, does not have a head or a tail, and doesn’t even really look like a dog. That’s on purpose, Robert said, explaining that the company’s aim is to create public trust with robotic devices in anticipation of them being in people’s homes. Hannah Rossi, a field application specialist, was at the controls Tuesday, demonstrating Spot’s moves. The Spot at the State House was fitted with a retractable lever that functions similar to a hand. Other devices that can be attached including mapping tools, cameras and at the shop employees have created a margarita mixer attachment. “That’s the fun part,” Robert said.

author: NTN24
title: Tormenta solar que impactó la Tierra durante el jueves produjo espectaculares auroras boreales en distintas partes del mundo
text: [aurora boreal](/temas/aurora-boreal) Tormenta solar que impactó la Tierra durante el jueves produjo espectaculares auroras boreales en distintas partes del mundo El jueves 10 de octubre una tormenta solar impactó la Tierra y desencadenó una ola de auroras boreales. El colorido espectáculo pudo apreciarse en los cielos de algunas partes de Estados Unidos, México y otros países. Se trató de una tormenta geomagnética de nivel G4 (severa) que impactó el planeta durante la mañana del 10 de octubre y que posiblemente continuará este viernes 11, según Shawn Dahl, del Centro de predicción Meteorológica Espacial de Estados Unidos. Dicho fenómeno se produce cuando el Sol se aproxima -o posiblemente se encuentra- en el punto álgido de su ciclo de 11 años, cuando la actividad es mayor. La reciente tormenta geomagnética fue de un nivel inferior al máximo posible, G5, que fue observado en mayo, cuando el planeta experimentó sus tormentas geomagnéticas más potentes en dos décadas. Este fenómeno natural produce coloridos espectáculos en los cielos nocturnos lejos de los polos, que en el hemisferio sur son conocidos como auroras australes y en el hemisferio norte como auroras boreales. Con la reciente actividad del Sol, estos fenómenos pudieron apreciarse en Portland, Maine, Estados Unidos. Así como en otras latitudes como en el norte de México, Bahamas y Turquía. Para que la gente observe mejor este tipo de fenómenos es recomendable que usen sus cámaras o teléfonos, ya que las imágenes digitales de hoy en día a menudo pueden captarlas incluso cuando el ojo desnudo no puede. Pese a que la tormentas geomagnéticas brindan este tipo de espectáculos para la humanidad, no todo es positivo, ya que pueden perturbar los satélites que orbitan la Tierra y afectar a cosas como las señales de radio y los sistemas de posicionamiento GPS.
